completed.task: Fixed critical PID tracking bug in test_helpers.sh
completed.description: Root cause: start_stalld() was capturing shell PID instead of actual stalld PID
completed.problem: When stalld forks or output is redirected, $! captures the shell PID, not stalld
completed.solution: Use pgrep -n -x stalld to find the real stalld process after backgrounding
completed.impact: All tests using start_stalld() now correctly track stalld process

completed.description: Removed 6 instances of redundant & after start_stalld calls
completed.problem: Tests were adding & after start_stalld which already backgrounds the process

completed.task: Fixed output redirection issues in test_logging_destinations.sh
completed.description: Redirecting start_stalld output captured function messages instead of stalld's output
completed.problem: start_stalld > file 2>&1 redirects the entire function output including echo statements
completed.solution: Bypass helper for output tests, call ../stalld directly and set PID via pgrep
